title: PERTURBATOR Signs To Nuclear Blast, Announces European Tour With GOST & KAELAN MIKLA
description: There's a new album coming, too.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 5 hours ago
excerpt: There's a new album coming, too.
text: Perturbator has signed with Nuclear Blast after having an illustrious career on the largely-defunct Blood Music. Perturbator is currently plotting the release of his new album, which Nuclear Blast notes has recently been completed. "Glad to finally announce that I'll join forces with Nuclear Blast for future projects and even happier to tell you that I'll hit the road again this November with my friends Gost and Kaelan Mikla, it's been way too long," said Perturbator mastermind James Kent. "I'll give you some updates very soon." Perturbator, Gost, and Kaelan Mikla will hit the road starting on November 5 at the Sterelux in Nantes, France. Tickets are available here. 5/11 FR, Nantes Sterelux6/11 FR, Lille Aeronef7/11 UK, London O2 Forum Kentish Town8/11 UK, Manchester Damnation Festival11/11 AT, Vienna Arena12/11 HU, Budapest Dürer Kert13/11 CZ, Prague SaSaZu14/11 DE, Berlin Huxleys17/11 LT, Vilnius Loftas19/11 FI, Helsinki Kulttuuritalo21/11 SE, Stockholm Fallan22/11 DK, Copenhagen The Grey Hall23/11 NO, Oslo Rockefeller25/11 DE, Hamburg Gruenspan26/11 NL, Nijmegen Doornroosje27/11 BE, Brussels Ancienne Belgique28/11 DE, Cologne Live Music Hall29/11 FR, Meisenthal La Boite Noire1/12 DE, Munich Muffathalle2/12 SO, Ljubljana Kino Šiška3/12 IT, Milan Live Club4/12 CH, Lausanne Les Docks5/12 FR, Paris Le Bataclan6/12 FR, Paris Le Bataclan Want More Metal? html:
Perturbator has signed with Nuclear Blast after having an illustrious career on the largely-defunct Blood Music. Perturbator is currently plotting the release of his new album, which Nuclear Blast notes has recently been completed.

"Glad to finally announce that I'll join forces with Nuclear Blast for future projects and even happier to tell you that I'll hit the road again this November with my friends Gost and Kaelan Mikla, it's been way too long," said Perturbator mastermind James Kent. "I'll give you some updates very soon."

Perturbator, Gost, and Kaelan Mikla will hit the road starting on November 5 at the Sterelux in Nantes, France. Tickets are available here.
